isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Turbocharger - Inspection - Compressor Impeller, Turbine Wheel and Turbocharger Pedestal

svcproc.title: Compressor Impeller, Turbine Wheel and Turbocharger Pedestal

step1.para: Inspect the compressor impeller and turbine wheel for blade erosion, bending, breakage or deposits. Replace the entire turbocharger assembly if any blades are damaged.
Deposits on the compressor impeller, and turbine wheel can be caused by the following conditions:

item.para: High air inlet restriction allows oil to be transferred from the turbocharger center housing, resulting in oil deposits.
Excessive oil consumption can result in turbine wheel carbon deposits.
Engine overfueling can result in excessive operating temperatures, which can cause aluminum components to melt. Such deposits may be found on the turbine wheel if such a failure occurs.

figure.caption: Checking for Turbine/Compressor Housing Wheel Rubbing

step1.para: Set the turbocharger on a work bench with the shaft in a horizontal position. Rotate the shaft and check for any wheel rubbing within the housings. The wheels must spin freely when turned by hand.
Inspect the turbocharger pedestal for cracks, worn spots and other damage.
